name: Sofi Marinova
description: '''Sofiya''' '''Marinova Kamenova''' ({{langx|bg|София Маринова Каменова}}, {{IPA|bg|soˈfi maˈrinova|pron}}), known professionally as '''Sofi Marinova''' ({{Langx|bg|Софи Маринова}}) is a [[Bulgarians|Bulgarian]] [[Chalga|pop-folk]] and ethno-pop singer. She is often called "the Romani pearl" and "the Romani nightingale". In February 2012, she won the Bulgarian Eurovision national final with the song "[[Love Unlimited (Sofi Marinova song)|Love Unlimited]]", and went on to represent Bulgaria in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2012|2012 Eurovision Song Contest]] in [[Baku]], [[Azerbaijan]]. She has collaborated with many other Bulgarian singers such as [[Preslava]], [[Azis]], and [[Toni Storaro]].
